results.title: Show me English: a visit to the doctor [episode 5]
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Ministry of Education, David Ferris, Trevor Lunn and Jeff Spencer
results.brief_description: A series of programmes which aim to help adult migrants communicate in everyday situations. On the second visit to the doctor, Tina is given the result of her test and is prescribed medication and given advice on the importance of diet and rest. Home tutor program by the Adult Migrant Information Service.

results.title: Show me English: a visit to hospital [episode 4]
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Ministry of Education, David Ferris, Trevor Lunn and Jeff Spencer
results.brief_description: A series of programmes which aim to help adult migrants to communicate in everyday situations. The receptionist at a large hospital gives directions to Tina on how to find the Pathology Department. Home tutor program by the Adult Migrant Information Service.

results.creator_credit: Victoria. Ministry of Education, David Ferris, Trevor Lunn and Jeff Spencer
results.brief_description: A series of programmes which aim to help adult migrants communicate in everyday situations. Tina swaps her sons jeans for another size. Home tutor program by the Adult Migrant Information Service.

results.title: Peace in action
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Ministry of Education and Jeff Spencer
results.brief_description: Peace is everyone’s responsibility. The peace program views peace issues being developed and taught in schools. Examples from primary and postprimary schools include art, student initiatives, plays, student councils and community interest. Professor Charlesworth raises issues for further discussion in schools

results.title: Computers in accounting
results.creator_credit: George Cass, Victoria. Ministry of Education and Jeff Spencer
results.brief_description: Shows some of the ways in which computer technology is being used in accounting firms and examines the impact of this on small business. Some of the problems encountered by small business when installing a new computer system are discussed. Also looks at the training needed by young people seeking employment in the accounting profession.

results.title: History's a snap: Australia as Australians saw it
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Ministry of Education and Jeff Spencer
results.brief_description: Examines the value of the ordinary snapshot over the years and the role it has played in detailing the history of the State of Victoria.

results.title: Indonesian cuisine
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Education Dept. Curriculum Branch and Ivan Gaal
results.brief_description: Focusing on a family of Indonesian immigrants and their Indonesian student guest, this program shows how Indonesians in Australia seek to preserve their culture through their cuisine and through cultural events which demonstrate their music, dress and customs.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Victoria. Education Dept. Curriculum Branch and Ivan Gaal

results.title: Gently down the stream
results.creator_credit: Education Department Western Australia and Ray Costello
results.brief_description: Shows a Year 10 canoeing expedition on the river from Mt Franklin to the Noralup inlet, Western Australia. Demonstrates that the focus of the Outdoor Education Project is preparation for expeditions; and shows the basic understandings for wilderness and adventure activities.
